metadata.title: Clean PicGo - AI Watermark Remover | Gemini Lossless
metadata.description: Free online AI watermark remover and image eraser. Gemini watermark lossless removal with Reverse Alpha Blending algorithm. Supports Midjourney, Stable Diffusion, DALL-E, Kling AI watermarks. Powered by LaMa model, runs entirely in browser for privacy.

hero.badge: AI Powered Â· Free to Use
hero.description: Easily remove watermarks, text, and unwanted objects from images using advanced AI technology.
hero.descriptionSub: No registration required. Processed entirely in your browser to protect your privacy.

faq.title: Frequently Asked

faq.moreQuestions: Have more questions? Feel free to ask on

howItWorks.question: How does Clean PicGo work?
howItWorks.answer:
Clean PicGo uses two technologies to remove watermarks:

1. **LaMa AI Model**: Works for all types of watermarks and unwanted objects, using deep learning to intelligently fill selected areas

2. **Gemini-specific Algorithm**: For Gemini AI image watermarks, uses mathematically precise Reverse Alpha Blending for lossless pixel recovery

All processing is done locally in your browser - images are never uploaded to any server.

geminiOptimization.question: What optimizations are made for Gemini watermark removal?
geminiOptimization.answer:
Compared to the original gemini-watermark-remover project, we've made these improvements:

â€¢ **Watermark Detection**: Pre-checks if Gemini watermark actually exists before processing
â€¢ **Numerical Stability**: Added Alpha ceiling protection to prevent division-by-zero pixel anomalies
â€¢ **Automated Integration**: No manual mode switching needed, auto-detects and processes on upload
â€¢ **Undoable Design**: Processing result saved as editing step, supports undo, can continue with AI model for other areas

lamaOptimization.question: What optimizations are made for LaMa model processing?
lamaOptimization.answer:
We've optimized LaMa model usage in several ways:

â€¢ **Web Worker Background Processing**: Model inference runs in a separate thread, main thread stays completely responsive during processing
â€¢ **Browser Caching**: Model files auto-cached after download, no re-downloading needed
â€¢ **Progressive Editing**: Supports continuous editing, each result becomes the base for next edit
â€¢ **Smart Masking**: Only processes user-painted areas, keeps everything else intact
â€¢ **History Support**: Multi-step undo/redo, saves up to 30 history steps

privacy.question: Are my images safe?
privacy.answer:
Absolutely! All Clean PicGo processing happens locally in your browser:

â€¢ Images never uploaded to any server
â€¢ AI model runs in browser
â€¢ We don't collect any user data
â€¢ All data cleared when you close the page

That's why we say "Processed entirely in your browser to protect your privacy."

formats.question: What image formats are supported?
formats.answer:
Clean PicGo supports common image formats:

â€¢ **JPG/JPEG**: Most common photo format
â€¢ **PNG**: Images with transparency support
â€¢ **WebP**: Modern image format by Google

Processed images are exported as PNG by default for best quality.

modelSize.question: Why does the first load require a model download?
modelSize.answer:
LaMa is a professional deep learning model for image inpainting, with ~200MB model file.

â€¢ **First use**: Download from CDN required, may take 1-2 minutes
â€¢ **Subsequent use**: Model cached in browser, no re-download needed
â€¢ **Gemini mode**: No model download needed, uses pure math algorithm

Download progress is shown in real-time.

limitations.question: Are there any limitations?
limitations.answer:
Clean PicGo has some technical limitations:

â€¢ **Image size**: LaMa model internally processes at 512Ã—512, larger images are auto-scaled
â€¢ **Gemini watermark**: Only removes visible semi-transparent watermarks, cannot remove SynthID or other steganographic watermarks
â€¢ **Browser support**: Requires modern browser with WebGL (Chrome 90+, Firefox 88+, Safari 14+)
â€¢ **Processing time**: Depends on device performance, mobile devices may be slower

geminiSaveMethod.question: Why does Gemini watermark removal fail for some images?
geminiSaveMethod.answer:
This is usually related to how the image was saved:

**Correct method**: After generating an image on Gemini / Nano Banana Pro, click the "Download" button to save. This preserves the original watermark information.

**Incorrect method**: Using right-click "Save As" or "Save Image" may cause the browser to re-encode the image, altering or losing watermark characteristics.

**Solutions**:
â€¢ Regenerate the image and use the download button
â€¢ If right-click saved images fail detection, try the universal AI eraser mode instead

Note: This is due to how browsers process images, not a limitation of this tool.

changelog.title: Change
changelog.description: Track Clean PicGo version updates and new features

changes.text: Add Gemini watermark auto-detection and lossless removal
Support Gemini detection toggle on homepage
Web Worker background thread for model inference, non-blocking main thread
Optimize homepage layout with core capabilities, FAQ sections
Optimize large image display, auto-fit viewport at 100% zoom
Optimize Gemini watermark notification, lightweight display in navbar
Support zoom and pan during image processing
Fix model cache status detection issue
Fix eraser area detection offset after moving image with hand tool
Fix compare slider controls too small on large images
Smart image inpainting based on LaMa model
Runs entirely in browser for privacy protection
Multi-step undo/redo, up to 30 history steps
Local model caching, no re-download needed
